title: The City in the Modern World
description: Comparative history of social, economic, political, and cultural changes in urban life during the nineteenth and twentieth centuries. Topics may include but are not limited to: commerce and labor; disease and death; conservation and preservation; gender and sexuality; race and ethnicity. 4 lectures. Fulfills GE D5 except for History majors.
prerequisites: Completion of GE Area A and one course from Area D1, D2 or D3
